alert.note: Alert for Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 8:40PM EDT until April 19 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Kinston affecting Lenoir County. For the Neuse River...including Kinston, Fort Barnwell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River At Kinston. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water overflows into lowlands adjacent to the river. Water access docks are also affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EDT Friday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 14.5 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 03/15/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps.
